references.formattedCitation: Wikipedia: the free encyclopedia that anyone can edit (2001-), Tell Abu Hawam.

Tsafrir, Yoram, L Di Segni, and Judith Green. Tabula Imperii Romani: Iudaea - Palaestina. Jerusalem: Israel Academy of Sciences and Humanities; Akademyah ha-le’umit ha-Yišre’elit le-mada“im; Agudah le-seker arkhe”ologi shel Yišra’el; Israel: Agaf ha-medidot, 1994.
Wikipedia: the free encyclopedia that anyone can edit (2001-), Tel Shikmona.
Talbert, Richard J. A., ed. Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World. Princeton, N.J.: Princeton University Press, 2000. http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/43970336.
Wikipedia: the free encyclopedia that anyone can edit (2001-), Haifa.

Depauw, Mark, Tom Gheldof, Herbert Verreth, Nico Dogaer, Willy Clarysse, Yanne Broux, Gert Baetens, and Heinz-Josef Thissen. Trismegistos: An Interdisciplinary Portal of the Ancient World. Leuven, 2006. http://www.trismegistos.org/.
Marc Wick, and Christophe Boutreux. GeoNames, 2005. https://www.geonames.org/.
Wikidata: The Free Knowledge Base That Anyone Can Edit. Wikimedia Foundation, 2014. https://www.wikidata.org/.

Plinius Secundus Maior, C. Naturalis Historiae. Edited by Karl Friedrich Theodor Mayhoff. Bibliotheca Scriptorum Graecorum et Romanorum Teubneriana. Lipsiae: Teubner, 1906. http://latin.packhum.org/loc/978/1/0.
Kiesling, Brady. ToposText – a Reference Tool for Greek Civilization. Version 2.0. Aikaterini Laskaridis Foundation, 2016-.

Michael McCormick, Giovanni Zambotti, Leland Grigoli, and Kelly Gibson, eds. The Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations. Cambridge (Massachusetts): Harvard University, 2007. https://darmc.harvard.edu/.

murex
title: Tel Shiqmona
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Shiqmona, Tell es Samak ISR
description: An ancient settlement located near the coast of the modern city of Haifa, Israel. Archaeological evidence indicates habitation there from the late Bronze Age through the late Byzantine period. Strabo describes the city as a ruin in his time.
rights: Copyright © The Creators. Sharing and remixing permitted under terms of the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License (cc-by).
